author: bakonpancakz
comment: This won't detect my Moto 360 and my watch says it's installed but not seen on any devices. The trial ended and only had for only 10 minutes. I just wish I can see my laptop battery too. But other than that it was a great app :).

author: John Holmstadt
comment: Tried this out so I could check the charge state on my Huawei Watch while it is on the charger. Never showed the watch, even though it shows it was installed.
title: Good idea, just doesn't work.

author: Mark Ridgeway
comment: Not working reliably enough for my use. What would help is some detailed documentation about how it works. I have a wifi tablet that I want to monitor. It has multiple users and the wifi is switched off overnight. This wouldn't be uncommon. And whilst it does generally work that is possibly because someone will turn on the screen which seems to wake it up. But it shouldn't need the screen to be active - the purpose of the sw is to prevent people picking up the tablet and finding a dead battery. Also I am not receiving Chrome notifications. That could be at my end. But there is no assistance to help find out where to look inside Chrome.  However, it is worth a try to see if it works for your situation. But give it the full month to see if it is reliable. It wasn't for my purposes.  Only 2 stars. Based on the principle that if you pay for an app then it should come with detailed instructions and support.
title: Not mature enough for a paid app

author: Bart B
comment: It did work after installation by not anymore.
title: Does work some times

author: Tomer Aharon Schwartz
comment: It was nice if the battery percentage will be showing in the extension icon instead of pressing it.
title: Great app it, working just graet

author: Stefan Curcan
comment: Just installed in on 4 devices and it works like a charm. Unlike Potential which got all the fame.

author: Casper Talvio
comment: Wear watch doesn't show up and web extension wont work.

author: UmperLumper1968
comment: good but not seeing my Wear Tag Connected watch :(

author: James Simmons
comment: Great deal
title: James Simmons

author: Krasimir Kazakov
comment: I have two "Nexus 5" devices. One is from an old installation and I want it to be removed. There's no "Delete" button or link or whatsoever.  Rename with chrome extension does not work, just pops up something and closes it quickly.  When the trial is over, if those two things are not addressed, it's not worth even the $0.99, sorry.  One idea for notification: if the battery drains too fast while my screen is off (like 5% in 30 minutes or whatever, configurable) notify me that something is eating my battery, so I can reboot the device. Will be REALLY useful.
title: Great app, but BUGS

author: Dinico Win
comment: Also clean up the coding, kind of laggy. Nothing to bad, but have experienced a crash. On HTC one m8 and Moto 360.
title: Materialize the icon

author: Raymond DeMay
comment: I love the integration with the Chrome app and the fact it detected my Moto 360, unfortunately it detects the watch twice and I cannot remove one of them.
title: Fantastic and useful app

author: Francis Bawasanta
comment: It works great on my phone (4.4.4) but  crashes on load up on my Nexus 7 which is also 4.4.4...
title: Bugs

author: Azharuddin Ansari
comment: Bugs but nice material design👌
title: Moto G

author: Jaffa Beech
comment: yea spotted it and thought great idea. however the Chrome extension installed but after selecting 'sign in' and prompted with authentication request, doesn't move from the OAuth Redirect Page. bit of a fail on my Mac with Mavericks running latest Chrome.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Jaffa, thanks for your feedback! Please remove the Chrome extension and add it again, this can unfortunately happen sometimes during the first setup - but it definitely works :-)!

title: good idea but chrome extension.. not passing authentication

author: Killian Griffin
comment: There is no obvious way to add other devices, like my Moto 360. The app force closes all the time too.  Edit: I did as the developer said and uninstalled/reinstalled, and my 360 does show up. I did have it connected the first time though, so I'm not sure what the problem was. Still crashes all the time though.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Killian, thanks for the feedback. All devices are added automatically on the first launch. Please uninstall the app, then make sure that your Moto 360 is connected to your phone and turned on, then reinstall the app and walk through the setup process again. The watch should then appear in the list of devices!

title: Not user friendly

author: Al McKinlay
comment: It does say this, but only on the android app when you are all ready to use it. It doesn't say on the Chrome extension or on the google play page.  It's very annoying because I don't want to have multiple accounts on my phone. If it supports apps accounts, I would give 5 stars, until then it's very frustrating for me. Not decided if I will actually pay for the full version when my trial runs out.  Google Apps accounts almost necessary for me.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Alistair, thanks for the feedback, I'll add a note on the Google Play description page regarding the Google Apps account limitation (short-term) and will work towards supporting Google Apps accounts (long-term)!

title: Doesn't support Google Apps accounts

author: Ayush Kumar
comment: Why does it need access to Google app engine? It also crashes frequently.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Ayush, thanks for the feedback. Google App Engine is required to send the low-battery alert to your browser.

title: Disappointing

author: Tomás Sironi
comment: There are errors sometimes and UI needs some maturing.
title: Works good

comment: It keeps crashing all the time.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Rohan, thanks for the feedback. Are you able to reproduce the crash? Please email me at support@greatbytes.org and I'll be glad to fix it!

title: Very poor performance.

reply.author: Great Bytes Software
reply.content: Hi Sarwar, thanks for the feedback. Are you able to reproduce the crash? Please email me at support@greatbytes.org and I'll be glad to fix it!
